name: AgroSavfe
goal:
While most biological crop protection products are based on the use of micro-organisms, such as viruses, bacteria or fungi, AgroSavfe is focusing on biological molecules to tackle pests and diseases. AgroSavfe uses camelid binding domains (Agrobodies®), directed against pests’ and pathogens’ essential molecules, to develop the next generation of biological control agents. Agrobodies® have the advantage of acting directly and uniquely on the target organisms. As such, Agrobodies® combine a highly specific mode of action with a minimized risk of effects on wildlife, bees, growers and consumers.

Agrobodies® can be produced in a cost-effective manner by industrial-scale fermentation. The first generation of Agrobodies® protecting crops from fungal diseases is in the product development stage, while there are several complementary projects in the research phase.

AgroSavfe was established in January 2013 as a spin-off of VIB (Flanders Institute for Biotechnology), and is backed by a syndicate of renowned life sciences investors. A highly experienced and dedicated team warrants the successful development of the company.
euInitiatives:
AgroSafve NV will be visiting Brussels to have meetings with various EU Institutions and agencies and intend to apply under Horizon 2020 Funding

This grant application is intended:

1) For the product development of the first Agrobody®. We need to test the performance of the product on a broad range of crops, with focus on fruits and vegetables, against different fungal diseases in different growing areas.

2) Next to this product development project, we are conducting several discovery programs for novel biofungicides and bioinsecticides based on the Agrobody® technology platform.

3) To further develop the Agrobody® technology platform, with the focus on increasing throughput of the various assays. So, in the field of Agrobody® research, there are ample opportunities to collaborate with academic partners and specialized companies.
